intro: Prevostea breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered prevostea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are usually white or pale green. Prevostea breviflora is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
